comment.text: Configure deep link is used to display a title and subtitle for a configuration setting that allows users to customize a deep link within the portal settings. This translation key appears on a page in the portal settings category as part of a navigation bar, guiding users to configure their deep link.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Konfiguroi" is correct for 'Configure,' "hyperlinkki" is a more general term for hyperlink and doesn't fully capture the meaning of 'deep link'. A deep link is a specific type of hyperlink.

The English phrase 'Configure deep link' is best translated as 'Configurar link profundo' in Portuguese, rather than 'Configure o deep link'. 'Configure' is an Anglicism, while 'Configurar' is the correct Portuguese verb.

The translation 'දුඹුරු සබැඳියාව සකසන්න' literally translates to 'brown link configure'. This doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Configure deep link'.  'Deep link' refers to a direct link to a specific screen or function within an app.  'දුඹුරු' (dūburu) means 'brown', which is irrelevant.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be something along the lines of 'ලී້ນක් සබැඳියාව සකසන්න' (līnək sabaeṇiyāva sakasanna) – meaning 'Configure app link' or 'Configure direct link'. Alternatively, 'ඇප සබැඳියාව සකසන්න' (æp sabaeṇiyāva sakasanna) - 'Configure app link'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Nastaviť deep link" is a very literal translation. A more natural Slovak phrasing would be "Konfigurovať deep link" or "Nastavenie deep linku". "Nastaviť" implies setting something to a specific value, while "Konfigurovať" better conveys the process of configuring a deep link.

The translation 'Подесите дубоки линк' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Configure deep link'. 'Дубоки линк' is a literal translation of 'deep link' and sounds awkward. A more idiomatic translation would incorporate the idea of configuration.

The translation 'Podesite duboki link' isn't the most natural or accurate rendering of 'Configure deep link' in Serbian. While 'podesiti' is correct for 'configure', 'duboki link' is a literal translation of 'deep link' and might not be the common terminology used by Serbian speakers.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'Postavite duboku vezu' or 'Konfigurišite duboku vezu'. 'Postaviti' is a very common and natural verb for setting up or configuring something, and 'veza' is a more familiar term for 'link' in many contexts.
